availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Warren W. Clubb (Henry County, KY, farmer and nominee for Lt col of local home guard)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Barton H. Clubb and Sarah Clubb. Married to Frances Clubb. Student in Henry County in 1850. Farmer in Henry County in 1860. Household owned five enslaved persons in Henry County in 1860. Recommended for lieutenant colonel of the Henry County Home Guard in October 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District No. 1, p. 403B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision No. 1, p. 349.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision No. 1, p. 5.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Drennons Ridge Precinct Subdivision 63, p. 271B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Film #994038: Hart, Henderson, Henry, 1875, p. 639 of 645 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, “Warren W. Clubb (1839-1875)," Memorial # 75290785, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/75290785/warren-w-clubb (accessed February 17, 2021).
KYR-0002-022-0054.
